channel.title: Uzer sword
channel.description:
Well I decided to remake one of my older models. Didn't turn out too bad.
[img]http://img827.imageshack.us/img827/9875/uzersword1.png[/img] [img]http://img529.imageshack.us/img529/8421/uzersword2.png[/img] [img]http://img245.imageshack.us/img245/3810/uzersword3.png[/img] [img]http://img831.imageshack.us/img831/1726/uzersword4.png[/img]

It’s a nice clean design.

item.title: Uzer sword
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

dylan_0789:

H1, why must you insist on backing up everyone who makes flat models with an extruded side to them? Seriously, Mr Mopar has posted these same style models ever since he started modeling. He always makes flat models because he doesn’t seem to want to improve his skills. It’s not called flaming, you are just being over sensitive for him.

Over-sensitive? I was just telling them not to be mean to him because other than it being flat its a nice model…

Read full topic

item.title: Uzer sword
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“h1 sk1ller, post:16, topic:358540”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=455044.msg3334370#msg3334370 date=1283764568]

The model is terribly shaped. The handle would be amazingly uncomfortable in the hand as its rectangular, not round. If you gripped it hard, your hand would hurt after awhile. The model is flat, and has excessive amounts of polygons on the handle/hilt. With the shape of the handle, I am not sure where the handle ends and the hilt or pummel begins. There isn’t even an edge on the blade if you look closely.

Dude who cares, thats what you think but maybe he made it that way on purpose, he did a pretty good job on it so stop flaming…

It’s called ‘constructive criticism’.
[/quote]

It’s also called ‘constructive flaming’.[/quote]Constructive criticism is supposed to sound like “flaming.” Go on Machinima and watch an Engineering Win video. They ALL give constructive criticism to the play playing to help improve their game, even if they are pros. And no matter how good you get, there is always room to improve, and other can often help you improve in the areas you need to, which is what constructive criticism is.

Also, what Dylan stated isn’t what he thinks, it is factual. Mr Mopar has always used the same style and the models tend to seem horrifically flat and extruded, we all started calling his models cardboard at some point.

Read full topic
